parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To desire earnestly, long for; I have a strong affection for, love fervently. Middle voice from himeros; to long for.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To be well-pleased, think it good, be resolved. From eu and dokeo; to think well of, i.e. Approve; specially, to approbate.
From meta and didomi; to give over, i.e. Share.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
Alone, but, only. Neuter of monos as adverb; merely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the same as euaggelizo; a good message, i.e. The gospel.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural

str2: From psucho; breath, i.e. spirit, abstractly or concretely.
On this account, because, for. From dia and hoti; on the very account that, or inasmuch as.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
